Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot
Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.fluent

Class Figure

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.unipannon.virt.plot.fluent.Figure
  • public class Figure
extends java.lang.Object
    Highest level of the fluent interface in standalone mode. The figure has functions to create and display plots in a window like MATLAB.
    Author:
    Tóth Bálint
    See Also:
    Plot, Bar, Scatter, Log, Line, LineStyle, ScatterStyle, Series, FrameStyle, Category

      Mid-interface wrapper type for the Fluent interface.

      • position

                       int ypos)
        Fluent setter for the window position on the screen.
        Parameters:
        xpos - x coordinate of the window on the sccreen.
        ypos - y coordinate of the window on the screen.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • tiles

        public Figure tiles​(Figure.Tiles t)
        Initiates multiplot mode. With the Tiles class and its fluent interface, the number of rows and cloumns of the grid can be set. Those tiles then can hold plots.
        After this function the plots can only be added with the subplot function.
        Parameters:
        t - the tiles wrapper object of a rows and columns value..
        Returns:
        itself.

      • subplot

        public Figure subplot​(Figure.Positions pos,
                      hu.unipannon.virt.plot.fluent.Displayable plot)
        Adds a plot object to the multiplot grid. Can only be used after calling tiles. The position of the used tiles can be added with the Positions wrapper class.
        The positioning starts from the upper left corner and goes from left to right, up to down. If more than one position is specified, then the plot will strech all the added tiles.
        Parameters:
        pos - the positions specified by the Positions wrapper.
        plot - the plot to be displayed. Can be any implementation of Displayable.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • show

        public void show()
        The method to show the created figure from code. This can also be used in the JShell command-line environment.

      • plot

        public Figure plot​(FrameStyle style,
                   Line... lines)
        Fluent interface function to add a lineplot object to the figure.
        Parameters:
        style - outer styling of the plot.
        lines - lines created by the Line's fluent interface.
        Returns:
        itself.

      • plot

        public Figure plot​(Line... lines)
        Fluent interface function to add a lineplot object to the figure. This function will use the default frame styling.
        Parameters:
        lines - lines created by the Line's fluent interface.
        Returns:
        itself
